page.title: 07Kinver Country Fayre
page.content: Each year, on a Saturday in May, the High Street of Kinver is closed to all vehicles for the country fayre. All the traders and organisations in the village put up stalls. Many stalls sell food. The school parents association made pancakes. Others are side shows where you can try your luck to win a prize. There are bands and morris dancers. This year there was a display of old bicycles. The fire brigade bring their engine for children to sit in. Visitors come to the Fayre from all over the West Midlands.
